storyInfo: Anastasio musters a party to pursue Thorns and the rest. La Conquista is hit and Thorns puts his hand into an Arts energy field to salvage the collapsing Corazonix.

attributes.content: What are you up to this late at night? I could see your torch from a mile away.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Night watch.
attributes.name: Worried Pirate

attributes.content: You forget we're in a town? No saltfins barging into the camp at night, and the roof above your head isn't getting blown away by a saltstorm.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: I know. Just not used to it.
attributes.name: Worried Pirate

attributes.content: Room's too hot, the bed doesn't shake. I can't sleep.
attributes.name: Worried Pirate

attributes.content: Besides, something's not right here. That Calificador, Silver, brought us here, but where is he?
attributes.name: Worried Pirate

attributes.content: Probably just thinks he's too good for us.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: The townsfolk are still on their guard against us. That's why they brought us here at night and hid us in these abandoned shacks.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Aren't we people too? How're we different?
attributes.name: Worried Pirate

attributes.content: ...*sigh*
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Give me the torch. If you're that worried, I'll keep watch.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: You get some sleep.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: You'll need to get used to being 'civilized'.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: I see you're still eating the jerky from your ships.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Señor Javier?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Ah, yes, jerky.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: This kitchen hasn't seen use in quite a while, but Silver had it specially repaired. The utensils should be readily available.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I hear that you've always wanted to be a cook. So why do you not cook when you finally have a proper kitchen?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I just can't. Not today.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Whyever not? Is this still not enough?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: It's enough, I assure you. Never seen so many kitchen tools my whole life.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Why, then?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I insist on knowing, Señor Javier.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: When you cook, it's not the knife in your hand you're thinking about, but the people who'll be eating it.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: How can I cook when they aren't here?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: All your crewmates are here. If you mean the ones who obstinately continue to resist, neither of us need regret their poor choices.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: ...Tch.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You have obtained so many things. Precious things. A kitchen, food...
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Silver gave us this stuff, not you. Why're you the one preaching at me—
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Silver is dead.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: ...You killed him, didn't you?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: I did.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: What about us? You gonna kill us too?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: No. You are to walk the very path I did. The path of atonement.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Get any sleep?
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: I wish. I could live with the heat and the bed not shaking, but my room doesn't even get a breeze! Felt like my face was gonna turn to stone.
attributes.name: Worried Pirate

attributes.content: Count your blessings.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Look at the older mates. The wind's blown their faces right crooked. It's enough to send people running off screaming.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: You're young, so you still got the chance to grow up into a real beauty.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: I don't see any smoke from the kitchen. Is Javier still not cooking?
attributes.name: Worried Pirate

attributes.content: I'll talk to him.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Our clerics have searched every corner of your den. There was no compass.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: ...Guess it got burnt to ash.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: The key figures in this affair—the girl who stole the compass, the graverobbing cannibal, and your former leader...
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: All have entered the depths of the Salt Flat with their ill-gotten gains.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: You want us to go after them?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You know better than I how to navigate the Flat, and you know the fugitives well.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: How much you paying?
attributes.name: Eager Pirate

attributes.content: ...Excuse me?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: We work, you pay. Isn't that supposed to be how things work around here?
attributes.name: Eager Pirate

attributes.content: The Flat's got a thousand ways to kill you. Massive saltfins, dozens of meters long—could tear you apart just by shaking their heads!
attributes.name: Excited Pirate

attributes.content: And Skeletal Reef is the worst of it. The steam blasts there could punch a hole right through you!
attributes.name: Excited Pirate

attributes.content: If we're risking our necks, we need a proper bounty.
attributes.name: Excited Pirate

attributes.content: Quiet, you fools! I'm sorry, we don't need—
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: What don't we need?! We've only been here a single night, so how're we supposed to put food on the table without work?!
attributes.name: Eager Pirate

attributes.content: Calm down, that's not what he meant.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: You see, Señor Alguacil...
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: The caravans under inspection were carrying both coin and trade goods.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I have no use for such worldly possessions.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Hah, I knew they were hiding the good stuff from us!
attributes.name: Excited Pirate

attributes.content: Wait, it's not what you think—
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You heard him, mates! Do the work, get the loot. Now quit yapping and start moving!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Anastasio sees those before him as puppets of desire. Regardless of their intentions, he believes their desires will inevitably lead them down the path of evil.

attributes.text: 'Much like the pits of hell, the greed of man is bottomless.'

attributes.content: Are you an idiot? What do you think happened to Silver?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Church conspiracies are above my pay grade. Best I can do is play the fool.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: There's no conspiracy, Rus. Silver's dead. Anastasio killed him.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: He's no schemer, but a complete lunatic. And now, there's no one to keep him in check.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You got a better idea?
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: You know how the others see you. Your word as the leader isn't even worth a hot meal.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Not that you're even cooking anymore.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: I can only defend you for so long, Javier.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: ...Fine, let's board those ships.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Ugh... it's so bright...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: It hurts... everywhere...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You awake? You had a bit of fever last night, but it's gone down. Have some water.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: Pascuala sits up and takes the bottle Teach offers her. The bionic seadragon is hard at work across the deck carrying a wooden plank while flapping its wings.
Juana stands at the bow, gazing into the distance. Behind her, Elysium twists his whole body as he strains to turn the heavy helm wheel, like some strange exercise routine.
The high sun shines bright. It hurts a little bit.
This is our last bit of water. One pouch per person. Make it last.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: ...Is there anything I can do?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Glad to see you up and about again, chica.
attributes.name: Juana
Juana
attributes.content: Repair the hull, reinforce the mast, process the food...

attributes.name: Juana
attributes.content: There's plenty.
Leaf's helping out with the repairs. Let her rest a little longer.
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: I lived through whatever that was yesterday, we didn't hit any skeletons all night, or get run over by a saltfin. Now I even have water to drink...
attributes.name: Pascuala
Pascuala
attributes.content: *cough*...

attributes.name: Pascuala
attributes.content: So I'm gonna do my part... to get out of this alive!
Give me your hand. I'll help you up.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: —Hyup!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Here, your water.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: And your portion of jerky. We talked about it and thought it'd be best if you focused on fixing the compass. We can worry about everything else.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: As long as we have that, we'll find our way. As for the rest, we'll cross that bridge when we come to it.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: How much time do we have?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: According to Señora Juana, they'll catch up to us by tomorrow morning at the latest.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: That soon? That's not nearly enough time to fix the compass.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Just do your best. If you can't get it done, she said she'll risk the Skeletal Reef, compass or not.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: And this is for you.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: A modified communicator. It'll let us talk in even the most extreme environments.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Okay...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Finshit! I see sails!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Sails! Southwest—
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: You stay here. I'll go help!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I can see their sails.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Increase speed. Catch up to them.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I wouldn't recommend that.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: And why not?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Based on their current heading, if we did, we'd only force them into the Skeletal Reef.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: What of it?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: That's no place for mere mortals! Sure, maybe they'll die in there, but we can't get in either!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Irrelevant.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Please reconsider, Señor Alguacil. The compass'll probably get destroyed too!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: That is not your concern.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I've sailed the Salt Flat for decades. I know how to stop a salt ship. At least let me try. It'll prevent a lot of needless deaths.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: ...Do not squander this chance, Señor Javier. You have very few left.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Javier!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: ...Javier!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: What are you thinking?! It's been years since we pulled off something like that, let alone against Juana!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: I know it won't be enough to stop her, but forcing them to change heading is still better than herding them into Skeletal Reef.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: And if you fail? Whatever's left of your authority will be gone. You'll lose control of the fleet!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Neither will groveling to Anastasio help me keep it.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Just listen to me, one last time! Maintain a steady speed with this ship and have another go around to cut them off from the east!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Are they down a ship? Did it hit a saltfin or something?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: No one taught by me would make a mistake like that, on flat land no less.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Eyes sharp! Every last one of those salt ships is faster than this antique.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: They could easily cut us off before we make it into the Skeletal Reef.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: What happens if they do?
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: We're at a disadvantage in both numbers and equipment. We wouldn't stand a chance.
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: Then we won't let them!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: The ship tailing us is going too slow and not even raising its flag. They want us to let our guard down, so another can go around in front of us.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Did you really think I would hesitate to sail into the Skeletal Reef at this point, Javier?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Full sails ahead! Set course for the Skeletal Reef! Maximum speed!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: They're accelerating, Señor Alguacil.
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: This is far from the scenario you envisioned, Señor Javier.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Raise the flag! Hail the other ship, tell them to go full sail!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: And what of us?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I will take the helm.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Señora?! Why are you turning? This is inviting them to open fire!
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: If they do, they'll have to slow down to find an angle for their cannons.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: That's our chance to lose them.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Gunners, at the ready!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Sailors heave heavy balls made from salt and fin dung into the cannons.
Fire!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Once again, Juana dances with her helm. The rudder carves through the Salt Flat, as if slicing its flesh, while the massive ship tilts and glides across the salt desert at an impossible angle.
Salt cannonballs whistle past, landing only meters from La Conquista and spraying salt everywhere.
The sails push the ancient ship towards the heart of the Flat, where few have tread.
A rumble stirs within the salt cloud. Pascuala peers through her blurry spyglass, straining to identify its source, only for a wind-filled sail to suddenly consume her view.
It is the salt ship that has disappeared from the pursuing squadron.
Pascuala puts down her spyglass with a jolt as the salt ship, trailing a billowing cloud of salt dust, barrels straight toward them!
It's gonna hit us!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Evasive maneuvers! Evasive maneuvers!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: No! That's what they want—for us to slow down or turn!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: The main sails of that ship are at the bow! It's not designed for ramming!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Let them try! If they do, they'll never catch us again!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Forward!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Hruff—!
The sound of canvas straining in the wind fills everyone's ears as La Conquista charges on, evading the salt ship's interception.
For the first time in decades, it rides proudly at the head of the fleet again.
You're out of your mind, Juana!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You should have known that the moment you mutinied!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Catch them.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Javier!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: ...Fine. I'll take command! Full sail ahead!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Javier stops giving orders. He knows no one will listen anymore.
He passes through the crowd and climbs the ship's bow. He sees the towering skeletons just ahead of La Conquista.
The Skeletal Reef: a labyrinth of bones, the pulsing heart of the Salt Flat, a realm of death where no mortal dares tread. Yet, La Conquista sails toward its valleys, dauntlessly, recklessly.
Despite the constant bumps and jolts, Isidro's eyes remain fixed on the Corazonix floating at the center of the transmutation table.
Layers of Arts energy fields have separated it. The insides glow with a metallic gleam.
Even the slightest motion is reflected upon its surface through the needle of the probe.
The rusted alloy has been successfully isolated. The newly added alloy has been successfully integrated.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Now, for the last step, to etch a new Originium circuit inside the Corazonix... I can't afford to make a single mistake.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: There is no time to test the effects of the circuit. We have only one chance.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Steady, steady...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Another jolt sends the dismantled compass components on the table spilling onto the ground.
With one hand holding the probe, Isidro draws his sword with the other and stabs the cabin wall with it to steady himself.
El Dominio del Mar... If the pirates can fight in the wind and waves with this technique, then I can use it to steady myself amidst this turbulence!
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: With each tilt of the ship, Isidro counters with a thrust of his sword. Soon, the cabin is in chaos—a pot covers one of his feet, while a piece of canvas wraps around his leg.
He pays no heed to them. The only thing he sees is the trail of liquid Originium drawn by the needle of his probe.
Almost there...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Sweat runs down his cheeks and into his mouth. He feels control slipping from the hand holding the probe as his strained muscles verge on spasming.
I did it! I did it!
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Now, all that's left is to insert the shaped Corazonix back into the shell of the compass...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: —Argh!
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Isidro forces his eyelids open through the blood and salt, and sees the Arts field beginning to go out of control under some kind of powerful Arts interference.
His probe lies on the other side of the cabin, the needle broken into several pieces. The components of the compass are nowhere to be seen, except for the outer shell.
Under the pressure of the overloaded Arts field, the newly-formed Corazonix begins to tremble violently.
Thorns! Thorns!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: What did that finshit Anastasio just do?!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: *cough* An Inquisition handcannon. He fired it into the cabin!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: Stay away from the alchemical equipment! It's out of control because of interference from the handcannon's Arts energy!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: What are you doing here, Señora Juana? Who has the helm?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Don't worry, it's in good hands.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Teach! Where's Teach?!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: She's over here! She's got a piece of broken wood stuck in her leg!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: Damn it... damn it! I can't stop the bleeding!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Thorns! Thorns! Say something!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Isidro opens his mouth, but his tongue does not obey. He forces himself to sit up. There is no time to think about how many ribs he broke.
On the transmutation table, the Corazonix starts to bubble as if it's boiling.
One moment of hesitation, and the last Corazonix of Iberia, their only hope for survival—
Will turn to dust.
He must retrieve it!
Isidro looks around desperately, but sees none of the compass's components, not even a working tool.
No... no...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Isidro stumbles to his feet. He cannot feel his left arm, but can still move his right arm.
He runs towards the transmutation table.
The resistance from the Arts field is much stronger than expected. It feels like putting his hand into boiling magma.
His glove offers no protection against the rampaging Arts energy. Isidro quivers as the energy corrodes his arm.
What are you doing, Thorns?!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: This is my Corazonix.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: ...MY compass!
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: The Corazonix dances in his palm, as though it has gained life.
It flows through every gash and hole the Arts energy left upon his arm.
Isidro has gazed upon this substance so many times, seeking a connection with it.
But now, in this very moment, he understands that it has become one with his flesh.
...Argh—!!
attributes.name: Isidro
